text: Introduction
Effective immune responses are characterized by T cell activation , which directs adaptive and innate immune responses to kill pathogens efficiently .
Dependent on the pathogen , T cells differentiate into different subtypes , such as Th1 or Th2 cells , which are most efficient in defeating microbial or parasitic invaders respectively .
A hallmark of Th1 and Th2 differentiation pathways is the exclusiveness of the individual phenotype leading to either Th1 or Th2 , but not to mixed populations .
The exclusiveness of this mechanism is provided by a polarization process , where Th2 differentiation inhibits Th1 commitment and vice versa .

Specifically <extra_id_0> interleukin 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - induced <extra_id_0> STAT6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibit differentiation into Th1 cells in the early phase of commitment [ 1 , 2 ] .

text: Recently , it was shown that <extra_id_0> T-bet <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> directly modulates <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> function , suggesting that transcription factors compete in the early differentiation phase of T cells , potentially integrating environmental signals to finally imprint the T cell phenotype [ 4 , 5 ] .

text: A <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dominated immune response has been shown to be essential in airway hyperresonsiveness [ 6 ] and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dominated responses can break antigen - specific immune tolerance [ 7 ] .

Overexpression of a dominant negative form of <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 8 ] or treatment with antisense - mediated <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blockade [ 9 ] decreased the severity of the allergic airway hyper - responsiveness .

text: The discovery of regulatory T ( Treg ) cells highlights another phenotype of T cells , which is essential for tolerance against self-antigens .
Naturally occurring , thymus - derived Treg ( nTreg ) cells are generated in the thymus and are assumed to protect against the activity of autoreactive T cells in the periphery .

These cells express the forkhead transcription factor <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and constitutively express <extra_id_0> CD25 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on their surface , but they lack expression of Th1 or Th2 cytokines .

text: Particularly interesting are those Treg cells that are generated in the periphery and thus are potential targets for therapeutic interventions .
These induced Treg ( iTreg ) cells were reported to express <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 10 ] .

The exact mechanisms of iTreg generation are unclear , but T cell receptor ( TCR ) triggering has been shown to induce <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and suppressive cells in human [ 11 , 12 ] , however the phenotype appears to be of transient nature [ 13 , 14 ] .

text: <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been demonstrated to be important for the persistent induction of these cells in vitro and in vivo , since animals lacking the <extra_id_0> TGF-betaRII <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on T cells have fewer peripherally iTreg cells [ 15 ] and suffer from a T cell - dependent multiorgan inflammatory disease [ 16 ] .

Although the effect of <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on natural and inducible Treg cell induction has been demonstrated repeatedly [ 15 , 17 ] , its molecular mechanisms remain to be identified .

The current study provides evidence that <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> play a competitive role in iTreg cell commitment as <extra_id_0> T-bet <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for Th1 and Th2 differentiation , respectively .

We show that <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction and that <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> limits <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in a <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated way , both in vitro and in vivo .
